text: The Viale Bligny is a street in the center Milan, it is the street where the prestigious Bocconi University stands. Viale Bligny is a commercial street in the centre of Milan. In Viale Bligny the artist Maurizio Cattelan has a studio where he created many of his most famous works. == Description == From Viale Sabotino (Porta Romana) to Via Col di Lana, Viale Bligny is part of the exclusive Bocconi district. The street is 1000 meters long. It links with Viale Sabotino and Corso Italia. Streets inside this area include Viale Sarfatti, Viale Sabotino and the Parco Ravizza, the park where Bocconi Campus students go to study and play sports. In the Ravizza Park there is an open-air art gallery.
